page.title: 15THE SCHOOL - WEST MEON
page.content: Records of teaching exist from 1684.The present school, built in 1852, was endowed by Mary Touchet. Until 1958 children attended this school for all of their school life, but since then have been receiving secondary schooling at Petersfield. First records show an average of 120 on roll.The average is now 50, spread over the same three rooms always used, and including children from Warnford, Woodlands, Privett and Bramdean. In 1940 provision of lunches started, hot water in 1955, paper towels in 1961 and central heating in 1964. In 1966 an office was built and in 1980 a mezzanine was created to make a library and room for staff, television and working groups. In 1985 39% of children walk to school, 43% come by car, 10% come by taxi and 8% come by bus.
